Package blocks

Class PositionBlock

java.lang.Object
blocks.PositionBlock
All Implemented Interfaces:
GameVariables
Direct Known Subclasses:
EmptyBlock, EndBlock, StartingBlock, Wall
public class PositionBlock extends Object implements GameVariables
PositionBlock creates a individual block of the maze, which could be a wall, empty space, start block, or end block.
Since:
March 2, 2024
Author:
Nick Clouse, Andrew Denegar, Molly O'Connor
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • PositionBlock

      public PositionBlock(int x, int y)
      Constructs a new StartingBlock based on the starting position.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate relative to the top-left coordinate of the chunk.
      y - The y-coordinate relative to the top-left coordinate of the chunk.

    • setBlockSize

      public static void setBlockSize(int width, int height)
      Set the size for all PositionBlocks
      Parameters:
      width - int width for all PositionBlocks in pixels.
      height - int height for all PositionBlocks in pixels.

      Draws block on g.
      Parameters:
      g - 2DGraphics to draw on.
      chunkXPosition - x coordinate of chunk.
      chunkYPosition - y coordinate of chunk.

    • getHitbox

      public int[][] getHitbox(int xPosition, int yPosition)
      Creates the hitbox for the positionBlock and returns it.
      Parameters:
      xPosition - X Position to base coordinates off of.
      yPosition - Y Position to base coordinates off of.
      Returns:
      A 2D int[] array that represent the hitbox of the block.

    • testMethods

      private boolean testMethods(int initX, int initY, int width, int height, String blockStr)
      Tests methods of PositionBlock. We made this a method so we could test all child classes within this file too.
      Parameters:
      initX - starting x coordinate
      initY - starting y coordinate
      width - of the block
      height - of the block
      blockStr - expected string representation of the block
      Returns:
      true if all tests were passed
